source_sentence: 佛說賴吒和羅經
translation: Foshuo laizha wuluo jing

source_sentence: 吳月支優婆塞支謙譯
translation: Wu Yuezhi Upāsaka Zhiqian Translation

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛與五百沙門俱遊拘留國，轉到黈羅歐吒國。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha traveled with 500 ascetics to the country of Detention and arrived in the southern state of Rāoṭṭa.

source_sentence: 國中人民婆羅門道人，皆聞佛轉遊到此國，聞佛功德妙達，無有貪婬瞋怒愚癡，人心所言者皆中正，但得佛道，自知所從來生，豫知去來現在之事；眼能徹視，知世間人民蚑行蠕動之類，所趣生死善惡之道；行即能飛能入地，出無間入無孔，自在變化所作；知世間人民及蚑行蠕動之類，心所念者皆豫知之；佛自制眼、自制耳、自制鼻、自制口、自制身、自制心；世間凡九十六種道，皆不及佛道；佛教天上天下人民，如父母教子，能使去惡就善。
translation: 國中人民婆羅門道人，皆聞佛轉遊到此國，聞佛功德妙達，無有貪婬瞋怒愚癡，人心所言者皆中正，但得佛道，自知所從來生，豫知去來現在之事；眼能徹視，知世間人民蚑行蠕動之類，所趣生死善惡之道；行即能飛能入地，出無間入無孔，自在變化所作；知世間人民及蚑行蠕動之類，心所念者皆豫知之；佛自制眼、自制耳、自制鼻、自制口、自制身、自制心；世間凡九十六種道，皆不及佛道；佛教天上天下人民，如父母教子，能使去惡就善。

source_sentence: 佛為天上天下人民作師，佛所教授諸天人民，皆得阿羅漢泥洹道。
translation: The Buddha serves as a teacher to the people of the heavens and the earth, and the people of the gods whom he teaches all attain the path of arhatship and nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 舉一國中人民皆言：「佛是吉祥之人，善說經戒，共往觀視其道德。」
translation: In one country, the people all say, "The Buddha is an auspicious person who well teaches the sutras and precepts and whose morality we all go to see."

source_sentence: 其國中人民，或有五十人為伴者，有百人為伴者，有五百人為伴者，共行到佛所，中有為佛跪者，中有繞佛三匝者，中有頭面著佛足者，中有叉手者，中有但說姓字者，人民皆坐。
translation: Some of the people of that country, whether accompanied by fifty people, a hundred people, or five hundred people, marched up to the Buddha, some knelt for him, some circled him three times, some put their heads at his feet, some saluted him with their palms together, and some simply spoke his name, and the people all sat down.

source_sentence: 佛為人民說經戒，人民皆叉手向佛。
translation: The Buddha taught the people the sūtras and precepts, and they all saluted the Buddha with their palms together.

source_sentence: 眾座中有一長者子，名賴吒和羅，在座中聽佛說經以著心中。
translation: In the midst of the crowd, there was an elder son named Rāṣṭrapāla who was listening to the Buddha preach the sūtras and fixing his mind on them.

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅自思惟：「如佛經戒者，不宜居家，居家者不能自淨學佛道也。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla thought to himself, "Such a person who follows the precepts of the Buddha's sūtras wouldn't be able to stay home, and a person who stays home wouldn't be able to purify himself and train in the Buddha Way."

source_sentence: 自思念：「不如除頭髮、被袈裟，行作沙門。」
translation: He thought to himself, "Why don't you just remove your hair, put on the reddish-brown robes, and practice as a monk?"

source_sentence: 黈羅歐吒國人民聞經戒皆歡喜，繞佛三匝各自還歸。
translation: The people of the country of Śāla Oṭa rejoiced when they heard about the sūtras and precepts, and they circled the Buddha three times before returning home.

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅中道屈還到佛所，前為佛作禮，叉手長跪白佛言：「我思念佛經戒不宜居家，居家者不能自淨學佛經道也。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla's middle way retreated to the Buddha, paid homage to him, knelt down with folded hands, and said to him, "I've thought about the precepts of the sūtras and how it's not advisable to stay home, for those who stay home can't purify themselves and train in the path of the sūtras.

source_sentence: 意欲除頭髮鬚、被袈裟，作沙門。
translation: I want to remove my hair, beard, and monks' robes and become a monk.

source_sentence: 願佛哀我，令我得作沙門。」
translation: May the Buddha have mercy on me and allow me to become a monk."

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝報父母未？」
translation: The Buddha said, "Have you rewarded your parents yet?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「未報父母也。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "I haven't yet repaid my parents."

source_sentence: 佛言：「諸佛法，父母不聽者不得作沙門，亦不得與戒。」
translation: The Buddha said, "According to the Buddha's teaching, if your parents don't listen, you can't become an ascetic, and you can't be given the precepts."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「諾！
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "Yes!

source_sentence: 請歸報父母。
translation: Please return to your parents.

source_sentence: 父母聽我作沙門者，我當來還。」
translation: I'll come back to my parents who heard me become a monk."

source_sentence: 佛言：「大善！
translation: The Buddha said, "That's very good!

source_sentence: 自思議之。」
translation: Consider it for yourself."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅即為佛作禮，而歸到父母前，白言：「我所聞佛經戒不宜居家，居家者不能自淨學佛經道也。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla then paid homage to the Buddha, went back to his parents, and said, "I've heard that the precepts of the Buddhist sūtras are not appropriate for living at home, and that people who live at home can't purify themselves and train in the path of the Buddhist sūtras.

source_sentence: 意欲除頭髮鬚、被袈裟，作沙門。」
translation: I want to remove my hair and beard, put on a monk's robe, and become a monk."

source_sentence: 父母聞子語聲，皆相對啼泣言：「我曹夫婦少子姓，禱祀諸天日月，四面叩頭，求哀子姓令續門戶後，常恐我卒死門戶滅絕。
translation: When their parents heard their son's voice, they both lamented to each other, saying, "My husband and wife have few children, so they prayed to the gods, the sun and moon, bowed their heads on all sides, and begged for pity for their sons and daughters to continue beyond the gate, always fearing that I might die and the gate would be cut off.

source_sentence: 我從天得汝一子耳，舉家共重愛，見汝不知厭足，設汝終亡，我夫婦當共坐守汝屍至老，今反欲生棄我曹去耶？」
translation: I found one of your sons from heaven, and my whole family loves you. Seeing you doesn't make us tired, suppose you were to die and my husband and wife would sit together and guard your corpse until it reaches old age, but now you want to be born and abandon us?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅語父母言：「如今不聽我到佛所作沙門者，從今以去不復飲、不復食、不復沐浴。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said to his parents, "Now, if you don't listen to me as a monk who goes to the Buddha, I won't drink, eat, or bathe again from now on.

source_sentence: 今聽我作沙門者善，不者當就死耳！」
translation: It's good that you'll listen to me as a monk now; if you don't, you'll die!"

source_sentence: 便却委臥空地不食，一日二日三日四日至五日不食。
translation: He then withdrew to lie down in an open space and didn't eat for one, two, three, four, or five days.

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅宗親九族中外，聞賴吒和羅從父母求欲作沙門，父母不聽，委臥空地絕穀水漿五日不食。
translation: Nine members of Rāṣṭrapāla's clan from China and abroad heard that Rāṣṭrapāla had asked his parents to become a monk, but they didn't listen, so he lay down in an open space, cut off grain and water and drank, and didn't eat for five days.

source_sentence: 中外宗親九族皆到賴吒和羅所，曉語令起沐浴飲食。
translation: The nine clansmen from the middle and outer families all went to Rāṣṭrapāla and told him at dawn to get up, bathe, and eat.

source_sentence: 語賴吒和羅言：「汝父母未有汝時，禱祀諸天日月，四面叩頭，求子姓適得汝一子耳。
translation: They told Rāṣṭrapāla, "When your parents didn't have you, they prayed to the gods, the sun, and the moon, and bowed their heads in every direction, seeking a son, just to get one of yours.

source_sentence: 汝當供養父母，為續門戶後。
translation: You must support your parents and continue to serve as a disciple.

source_sentence: 設汝終亡，父母常欲坐守汝屍至老，何況欲生別離去乎？」
translation: If you were to die, your parents would always want to sit by your corpse until you were old, so why would they want to be born apart and leave?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅亦不應。
translation: Neither should Rāṣṭrapāla.

source_sentence: 宗親九族皆復到父母前，啼泣謂言：「此兒終不受我諫也。」
translation: All nine members of his clan went back to his parents, lamenting and saying, "This son never accepted my advice."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅復有諸親厚知識，聞賴吒和羅欲到佛所作沙門，父母不聽委臥空地，不飲不食五日。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla also had close friends who heard that Rāṣṭrapāla wanted to become a monk at the Buddha's work, but his parents wouldn't listen, so he lay down in an open space, didn't drink, and didn't eat for five days.

source_sentence: 親厚知識皆到賴吒和羅所，諫曉令起沐浴飲食，語言：「父母未有汝時，禱祀諸天日月，四面叩頭，求子姓，適得汝一子耳。
translation: The well-meaning friends all went to Rāṣṭrapāla, told him to get up at dawn, bathe, and eat, and said, "When your parents didn't have you, they prayed to the gods, the sun and moon, and bowed their heads in every direction, seeking a son's name, but it was only fitting that they should obtain one son from you.

source_sentence: 汝當供養父母，為續門戶後。
translation: You must support your parents and continue to serve them from the front door.

source_sentence: 設汝終亡，父母常欲守汝屍至老，汝反欲生別離去耶？」
translation: Suppose you were to die, and your parents always wanted to keep your corpse until you were old, but you want to be born apart and leave it?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅亦不應。
translation: Neither should Rāṣṭrapāla.

source_sentence: 親厚知識復到父母前，啼泣各自拭淚語父母言：「宜放是子聽令作沙門。
translation: The close friend then went to his parents, wept, and wiped his tears as he said to them, "It's appropriate to release this son and allow him to become a monk.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如使樂道作沙門者，後可生相見；設不樂道者，自當棄道來歸。
translation: "If someone takes delight in the path and becomes a monk, they'll be able to meet each other later; if they don't take delight in the path, they'll abandon it and come back.

source_sentence: 當復如何乎？
translation: What should they do?

source_sentence: 今反空使死亡，臭爛為虫蟻作食，用死人軀為？」
translation: Now, it's empty, causing death, rotting, and feeding on insects and ants, using the body of a dead person as food?"

source_sentence: 今子大短氣沮欲死，父母家室妻子、妓人宗親知識，皆舉聲大哭。
translation: Now, when his son is so short of breath that he's about to die, his parents, his family, his wife, the courtesans, clansmen, and friends all lift their voices and weep.

source_sentence: 父母拭淚語賴吒和羅：「諸親厚知識與共約束，設放若作沙門以後，汝當復來歸，與我曹相見不？」
translation: Wiping their tears, the parents said to Rāṣṭrapāla, "Suppose you were to be released and become a monk, and then you'd come back and meet us?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「放我去到佛所作沙門，使我生不死，會當來歸，與父母相見也。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "Let me go and become a monk at the Buddha's work, so that I'll be born and not die, and I'll come back to meet my parents."

source_sentence: 父母聞子語聲便復大哭，即聽令去作沙門。
translation: When his parents heard the sound of their son's words, they again wept profusely and then obeyed the order to go away and become a monk.

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅大歡喜自念：「我不食五日，身體大羸瘦。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla was overjoyed and thought to himself, "I haven't eaten for five days, and I've lost a lot of weight.

source_sentence: 佛時從黈羅歐吒國至舍衛，相去五百里。
translation: At the time, the Buddha traveled 500 miles from Śrāvastī in Śāntarāṭṭha.

source_sentence: 且自養視，須我強健乃行。」
translation: Now, I'll nurture myself and look after myself until I'm strong enough to go."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅自養視數日，有氣力，前報父母言：「自安，我去到佛所作沙門。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla nursed himself for several days, then he had the strength to report to his parents, saying, "Be at peace, I'll go to the monastery where the Buddha works."

source_sentence: 父母復舉聲大哭，父母拭淚言：「可去，自愛也。」
translation: His parents again raised their voices and wept, and they wiped their tears and said, "You may go, for you love it."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅便以頭面著父母足，起繞父母三匝，便去。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla then put his head and face on his parents' feet, got up and circled them three times, and departed.

source_sentence: 轉到舍衛祇洹，前到佛所，為佛作禮，白言：「父母已聽我，佛寧可持我作沙門。」
translation: He went to Śrāvastī and Gipa, went to the Buddha, paid homage to him, and said, "My parents have listened to me; perhaps the Buddha will accept me as a monk."

source_sentence: 佛即用作沙門，被袈裟、受沙門經戒。
translation: The Buddha then used them as ascetics, put on the reddish-brown robes, and accepted the precepts of the ascetic scriptures.

source_sentence: 佛使諸阿羅漢，日共教授。
translation: The Buddha told the arhats to teach them together every day.

source_sentence: 不敢毀傷經戒，自思惟經道，便得四禪。
translation: They dared not disparage the sūtras and precepts, and after contemplating the sūtras and path for themselves, they attained the four meditation heavens.

source_sentence: 得第一須陀洹、第二斯陀含、第三阿那含、第四阿羅漢，便得四神足飛行，能以天眼達視、天耳達聽，天上天下人民及蚑行蠕動之類，皆聞知所言所念，自知宿命所從來生。
translation: After attaining the first stream, the second stream, the third non-returner, and the fourth arhat, he then attained the four miraculous powers of flight, the ability to see with the divine eye and hear with the divine ear, and the ability to hear what the people of the heavens and the world and crawlers and wrigglers all say and think, knowing on their own where they were born in their previous lives.

source_sentence: 隨佛十歲，如影隨人。
translation: They follow the Buddha for ten years, just like a shadow following a person.

source_sentence: 十歲以後，意念：「我初去家時，與父母辭訣，期當復還相見。」
translation: After he reaches the age of ten, he thinks, "When I first left home, I said goodbye to my parents, hoping to see them again."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅白佛言：「我初去家時，期當復還相見，願得行到父母所。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said to the Buddha, "When I first left home, I hoped to see them again and wished I could travel to my parents."

source_sentence: 佛念賴吒和羅，不復能入愛欲中如在家時，已從愛欲得度脫。
translation: The Buddha remembered that Rāṣṭrapāla could no longer enter into craving as he had at home, and that he had been liberated from craving.

source_sentence: 佛言：「大善。」
translation: The Buddha said, "That's very good."

source_sentence: 即為佛作禮而去。
translation: He then paid homage to the Buddha and departed.

source_sentence: 轉行到黈羅歐吒國，晨起被袈裟、持應器，入父母里中，向家門乞食。
translation: He traveled to the country of Śāla Oṭa, where he got up in the morning, put on his robe and carried a suitable container, went into his parents' house, and begged for food.

source_sentence: 舉家無肯應視者。
translation: No one in the family would agree to look after him.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 用沙門道故，生亡我大夫子，舉家惡見沙門，故不應視也。
translation: It's because they use the ascetic path that they were born and died as my great sons, and they hold hostile views of ascetics in their families, so they shouldn't look at them.

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅到家門，無有乞者亦無應視者，無有白者但得罵詈，亦不憂不愁。
translation: When Rāṣṭrapāla arrived home, there was no beggar, no one to look at, and no one to blame but to insult, and he wasn't sad or troubled.

source_sentence: 適欲去家，有一婢欲出門棄臭豆羹滓，賴吒和羅還顧見婢，問言：「若用是臭豆羹為？」
translation: When he was about to leave home, a servant wanted to leave the house and throw away the stinky bean curd, so Rāṣṭrapāla looked back at the servant and asked, "Would you use this stinky bean curd?"

source_sentence: 時婢言：「臭惡不可復食，故欲棄之。」
translation: The maid said, "It stinks and can't be eaten again, so I want to throw it away."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「如姉欲棄者，持用乞我。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "If you want to throw it away, take it and ask me for it."

source_sentence: 婢便以著應器中。
translation: The servant girl then put it in the container.

source_sentence: 婢陰識賴吒和羅手足語聲，即念：「是我大夫子也。」
translation: She recognized the sound of Rāṣṭrapāla's hands and feet, and she thought, "That's my husband's son!"

source_sentence: 即走入語其母：「大夫子已來在外。」
translation: She then went inside and told her mother, "The great man is here and outside."

source_sentence: 母大喜語婢：「審如汝言者，今日即免汝為良民，便以我所著身上衣被珠環，悉賜與汝。」
translation: She was delighted and said to the maid, "If you've done as you say, today I'll exempt you from being a good citizen and give you all the robes and jewelry I've worn."

source_sentence: 母便走至夫所，夫時適在中庭梳頭，語夫言：「婢見我子賴吒和羅來在是門。
translation: The mother then went to her husband's place, who was combing his hair in the courtyard at the time, and said to him, "The maid saw my son Rāṣṭrapāla coming through this door.

source_sentence: 我語婢言：『汝審見賴吒和羅者，我悉脫身上衣被珠環，乞匄與汝，免汝為良民。』」
translation: I said to the maid, 'If you see Rāṣṭrapāla, I'll take off all my robes and robes and beg you to give them to me, so I won't have to make you a good citizen.'"

source_sentence: 母語夫言：「疾起分布行求索之。」
translation: The mother said to the husband, "Get up quickly and walk around asking for them."

source_sentence: 夫即斂頭，走行於諸街曲里巷而求索之。
translation: He then gathered his head and walked through the streets, lanes, and alleys, searching for him.

source_sentence: 見賴吒和羅於屏處仰頭視日，適得飯時，便止食臭豆羹滓。
translation: He saw Rāṣṭrapāla looking up at the sun from a screened-in place, and when it was time to eat, he stopped eating stinky bean curd.

source_sentence: 公便前言賴吒和羅：「汝不當來歸於家好坐食美飯耶？
translation: The man then said to Rāṣṭrapāla, "Won't you come back home and sit down to eat a nice meal?

source_sentence: 而反於是間止食臭豆羹滓為？」
translation: Why did he stop eating stinky bean curd between now and then?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅語父言：「我棄家學道作沙門，無家，我當那所得家？」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said to his father, "I abandoned my family, trained as an ascetic, and became homeless; where will I get a home?"

source_sentence: 公呼共歸家，不肯隨去。
translation: He asked them to return home together, but they refused to go with him.

source_sentence: 公便宿請：「明日來，到家飯，行見汝母。」
translation: He then asked them to stay overnight, "Come tomorrow, have dinner at home, and meet your mother on the road."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「大善！」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "Very good!"

source_sentence: 公歸語嫗言：「賴吒和羅審來在此，我已宿請，明日當來飯。
translation: The duke returned and said to the woman, "Rāṣṭrapāla is here, and I've asked him to come tomorrow to eat.

source_sentence: 子受請，所當具者便饒具之。」
translation: Accept my invitation, and take whatever you need."

source_sentence: 母即呼舍中奴婢皆著前，告言：「我初入門時，父母所送我，金銀白珠珍寶，悉出著中庭地，以物覆其上。」
translation: The mother then summoned the servants in the monastery and told them, "When I first entered, my parents gave me gold, silver, white pearls, and jewelry, and I put them all out on the floor in the courtyard and covered them with things."

source_sentence: 婢即受母教，悉出金銀白珠珍寶，積著庭中，物覆其上，高出人頭上。
translation: The servants then obeyed their mother's instruction and gathered up gold, silver, white pearls, and jewelry in the courtyard and covered them with something to raise their heads above the ground.

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅，食時被袈裟、持應器，到父母家。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla went to his parents' house, wearing his robe and carrying a suitable container when he ate.

source_sentence: 父母遙見子來入門，母便取金銀積上覆去之，前以兩手把金銀散之。
translation: When his parents saw their son enter from a distance, his mother took the gold and silver, put it on top of him, and covered it with it.

source_sentence: 語賴吒和羅言：「見金銀珍寶，是汝母入門時所有也，汝父所有也，金銀珍寶無央數，汝可取，以布施飲食極自娛樂。
translation: He said to Rāṣṭrapāla, "The gold and silver that you see are treasures that your mother had when she entered the house and that your father had, and there are countless treasures of gold and silver that you can take and offer as food and drink to amuse yourself.

source_sentence: 用沙門作為？
translation: Will you use it as a monk's gift?

source_sentence: 不如作白衣自在家也。」
translation: Why don't you just become a white-clothed man at home?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅語父母言：「如使大人用我言者，我欲誡大人一事。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said to his parents, "If you would let your father use my words, I would like to admonish you about one thing."

source_sentence: 父母言：「大佳！
translation: His parents said, "Excellent!

source_sentence: 受教。」
translation: I'll accept your teaching."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「取寶物上覆皆用作囊，悉取珍寶盛著囊中，載著車上，持到恒水邊，視占深處以投其中。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "Take the things that are covered with treasure and use them as sacs, put all the treasures in the sacs, carry them on the chariot, carry them to the edge of the still waters, look into the deep end, and throw them in.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: What's the reason for that?

source_sentence: 畜財寶者，令人多憂，或恐縣官盜賊、或恐水火、或恐怨家。」
translation: Bringing in wealth and treasure makes people very sad, and they might be afraid of the magistrates, thieves, floods, or fires, or enemies."

source_sentence: 父母便生意言：「賴吒和羅不可以財寶化也。
translation: Their parents then told them, "Rāṣṭrapāla can't be turned into property.

source_sentence: 試持故時諸美人妓女化還之耳。」
translation: Perhaps you could return it to one of the beautiful women and prostitutes."

source_sentence: 母即到諸美人妓女所，教令悉沐浴莊嚴，著珠環服飾，如賴吒和羅在時所喜被服來出。
translation: Mother then went to the beautiful women and prostitutes and instructed them to wash themselves in adornment, wear jewelry and robes, and come out dressed as Rāṣṭrapāla had liked to be dressed when he was alive.

source_sentence: 母教諸美人妓女言：「汝出見賴吒和羅者，但言大家子！
translation: The mother told the beauty queens, "If you go out and see Rāṣṭrapāla, just say, 'My son!'

source_sentence: 何所玉女勝我曹者，而棄我曹行學道，更求玉女乎？」
translation: Why would someone who has a superior jade woman abandon our practice and training and seek another jade woman?"

source_sentence: 諸美人妓女即受母教莊飾出，諸美人妓女語賴吒和羅言：「大家子！
translation: The beautiful women and prostitutes then emerged decorated by their mothers' teachings, and the beautiful women and prostitutes said to Rāṣṭrapāla, "Great sons!

source_sentence: 何所玉女勝我曹者？
translation: What jeweled woman is superior to our own?

source_sentence: 而棄我曹行學道，更求玉女乎？」
translation: How could you abandon our training in Cao Xing and seek a jeweled woman?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「我不用索玉女故，棄諸姉去也。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "I didn't have to ask for a jeweled woman, so I abandoned the sisters."

source_sentence: 諸美人妓女聞之語即慚愧，長跪低頭以手覆面言：「以不用我曹作妻，反呼我曹為姉。」
translation: When the beautiful women and prostitutes heard that, they felt ashamed, knelt down, put their hands over their faces, and said, "Why don't you take us as your wives and call us your sisters?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅語父母言：「何為致相嬈？
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said to his parents, "Why did you cause this to be anathema?

source_sentence: 欲作飯者善，不能者已。」
translation: Those who want to cook rice are good, but those who can't have it already."

source_sentence: 父母即為出飯具著前，便飯食。
translation: The parents then put out a dinner service and put it in front of them, whereupon they ate.

source_sentence: 父母欲久視其子，恐飯已便捨去，勅閉諸門戶皆令下門鑰。
translation: Their parents wanted to look at their son for a long time, but they were afraid they might leave him after the meal, so they ordered them to close all the doors and make them close their gates.

source_sentence: 飯竟，為父母說經言：「諸野人畜獸不當拘閉，畜獸不得自在，且捨人走。
translation: When the meal was finished, he spoke the sūtra for his parents, saying, "Suppose wild animals aren't kept under lock and key, and the animals aren't allowed to go freely, and they abandon the people and leave.

source_sentence: 飯已，當去耳。
translation: After they finish eating, they'll go away.

source_sentence: 野獸得脫，便走入深山。
translation: Once the wild animals were freed, they then went off into the deep mountains.

source_sentence: 梳頭著澤畫眉粉白黛黑，可以化愚人耳；已度世之人，不可以此化也。
translation: Combing one's hair, wearing a luster, and painting one's eyebrows white and black can transform a foolish person; a person who's already crossed over to the other side can't be transformed like that.

source_sentence: 視子骸骨皮肉裹之，飾以金珠珥璫[王*(止/少)]瑤之人，向是曹人如入湯火中，火適無所愛。
translation: A person who looks at their skeleton and wraps it in flesh and bones and adorns it with gold, beads, carpets, and leggings [king*(stop/small)] will be like one who goes into a fire with hot water, for which the fire has nothing to love.

source_sentence: 香熏塗身可以化愚人，不可化度世之人也。
translation: Smudging his body with incense can convert a foolish man, but it can't convert a man who has crossed over to the world.

source_sentence: 不能自知當所為而為之，亦不能別父母，亦不能別兄弟，人心有所愛，不能自絕也。
translation: They can't know for themselves what they should do and do it, and they can't distinguish between parents and brothers, for their hearts have cravings that can't be cut off by themselves.

source_sentence: 婦女譬若眾水，水流入大海，愚人向女人，便流入泥犁中、禽獸中薜荔中，意欲脫於生死憂苦者，欲得泥洹道者，當遠離婦女。」
translation: A woman is like a multitude of rivers that flow into the ocean, and a foolish man turns to a woman, which flows into a mud plow, among animals, and among lilies. Those who want to escape the misery of birth and death and want to attain the nirvāṇa path should avoid women."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅為父母說經竟，便飛從天窓中出去，如猛師子走得脫。
translation: After he finished speaking the sūtras for his parents, Rāṣṭrapāla flew out of the window of Heaven like a fierce lion walking away and got loose.

source_sentence: 時國王名拘獵，與賴吒和羅少小親厚。
translation: The king of that country, named Kucha, was close to Rāṣṭrapāla as a child.

source_sentence: 王有一廬觀在城外，賴吒和羅飛往前入廬中，有樹名維醯勒，止坐其下。
translation: The king had a monastery outside the city, and Rāṣṭrapāla flew forward and entered it.

source_sentence: 時王拘獵偶欲出到廬遊戲，勅廬監令豫掃除，廬監被勅即行掃除。
translation: The king then went hunting and occasionally wanted to go out to play in the monastery, so he ordered the monastery superintendent to clean it up.

source_sentence: 見賴吒和羅在維醯勒廬樹下坐，廬監見之，即行白王：「掃除已淨。
translation: When he saw Rāṣṭrapāla sitting under the Vihīlā tree, the supervisor there saw him and said to the king, "The sweeping has been purified.

source_sentence: 王常可道說親厚知識賴吒和羅，今在廬中樹下坐。
translation: The king has always been able to tell that the trusted friend Rāṣṭrapāla is now sitting under a tree in Vaiśālī.

source_sentence: 王欲見者可孚行。」
translation: The king may act accordingly if he wishes to see him."

source_sentence: 王聞之大歡喜，即嚴駕而出。
translation: The king was greatly delighted when he heard that, so he drove out in full force.

source_sentence: 到廬外，下車步入至賴吒和羅所前，作禮却坐。
translation: When he got outside of his dwelling, he got down and walked in front of Rāṣṭrapāla, paid homage, and withdrew to sit down.

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「王來到，是大善！」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "The king has arrived, which is very good!"

source_sentence: 王言：「雖我自來者，卿是我少小知識，意欲持財物極意相遺。」
translation: The king said, "Even though I came here myself, you're a junior associate of mine who wants to leave behind property with great intent."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅報王言：「不宜持財物相遺也。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla replied to the king, "It wouldn't be appropriate to leave behind property.

source_sentence: 今我以棄重擔牢獄解去也，王復欲持牢獄重擔著我上耶？
translation: Now, after I've released myself from the heavy burden of prison, does the king want to put another heavy burden of prison on me?

source_sentence: 不宜持是來相與也。」
translation: It's not appropriate to give this to someone else."

source_sentence: 王言：「我當持何等相遺也？」
translation: The king said, "What will I give as a reminder?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「王但當言：『令我國熾盛，五穀豐熟，人民眾多，乞匃易得，可止我國中，我不得令吏民侵抂卿。』」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "The king should simply say, 'Let my country flourish, the grain is abundant, the people are numerous, and it's easy to get a begging spell, so you can stay in my country; I won't allow the officials and people to violate you.'"

source_sentence: 王言：「受教，當如所願賴吒和羅所言。」
translation: The king said, "Accept my teaching, and do as I wish for Rāṣṭrapāla to say."

source_sentence: 王言：「我欲有所問，願聽我言。」
translation: The king said, "I want to ask a question, so listen to what I have to say."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「大善！」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "Very good!"

source_sentence: 王便言：「凡人作沙門有四苦事，乃行作沙門耳。
translation: The king then said, "There are four things that are painful for a person to be a monk, and they're practicing being a monk.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者年耆，二者病瘦，三者孤獨，四者貧窮。
translation: One is old, two is sick and thin, three is lonely, and four is poor.

source_sentence: 人有是四苦者，乃行作沙門耳。
translation: These are the four kinds of suffering that people experience when they practice as ascetics.

source_sentence: 今我視卿，了無是四事，用何等故作沙門乎？」
translation: Now, when I look at you, I see that you don't have these four things, so what kind of reason do you have to be an ascetic?"

source_sentence: 王言：「所以年耆作沙門者，人老自念氣力薄少坐起苦難，不能遠行治生致錢財，正使有財產不能堅持，用是故除鬚髮作沙門；我視卿了無有是，頭鬚正黑身體完具，適是中年當自娛樂，時有父母啼泣，不樂卿作沙門。
translation: The king said, "That's why a person becomes a monk when they're elderly because they think to themselves that their energy is weak and their sitting up is difficult, that they can't travel far to cure birth and cause money, and that they precisely because they have possessions they can't hold on to them, they remove their hair and become a monk; I see nothing like that in you, and I see that your hair is perfectly black and your body is perfectly intact; it's time to entertain yourself in middle age, and there are times when your parents lament that they don't want you to become a monk.

source_sentence: 二者若人身被重病身體羸瘦，自念不能治生致錢財，正使有財產不能堅持，用是故除鬚髮作沙門；我視卿了無是，重病身體強健。
translation: Second, if a person is seriously ill and has a weak body, and they think to themselves that they can't cure themselves of birth and cause money and possessions, and that they can't hold on to their possessions, they remove their hair and become a monk because of that; I see nothing wrong with you, and you have a strong body that's seriously ill.

source_sentence: 三者人有孤獨一身，不能治生致錢財，正使有財產不能堅持，以是故作沙門；我視卿了無是，除王家宗親，視我國中尚無過卿者。
translation: Third, there's a person who's alone, can't heal himself or bring in money, and just because he has possessions, he can't hold on to them; therefore, he becomes a monk; I see you as having nothing, and besides the king's clan, I don't think there's anyone in my country who's better than you.

source_sentence: 四者人貧窮飢寒無以自給，自念貧窮無以治生，以是故除鬚髮作沙門，得乞匃以自活；我視卿了無是，我視國中富者，無過於卿者。
translation: Fourth, a person is poor and hungry and has nothing to feed himself, and he thinks to himself that he's poor and has no way to heal his life; therefore, he shaves his hair and becomes a monk, and he begs for food to feed himself; I see the minister as having nothing, and I see no rich person in my country who's better than the minister.

source_sentence: 人用是四苦故作沙門耳。」
translation: These are the four kinds of suffering that people use to become ascetics."

source_sentence: 王問：「寧復有異是四事作沙門者不？」
translation: The king asked, "Could there be another ascetic who does these four things differently?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「佛持是四事常自道說，皆更知之，用教誡人，我心中審如佛言，是故我除鬚髮被袈裟作沙門。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "The Buddha always explains these four things to himself and everyone knows them, so he teaches and admonishes people.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者人生無有能避於老者，無有能止身使不老者。
translation: First, there's no person in life who can avoid old age, and there's no person who can stop the body so that it doesn't grow old.

source_sentence: 二者無有能避於病者，身無有代人死者。
translation: Second, there's no one who can avoid being sick, and there's no one in his body who dies in someone's place.

source_sentence: 三者人死空身，不能齎持財產去。
translation: Third, when a person dies, his body is empty, and he can't carry his possessions with him.

source_sentence: 四者人至死，無有能厭於愛欲及財產者，人皆為財產愛欲作奴婢。
translation: Fourth, until death, there's no one who can become disillusioned with desires and possessions, and people are made slaves to the desires of possessions.

source_sentence: 佛為我說是四事，我心信之，故作沙門。」
translation: The Buddha taught these four things for me, and I believed them in my heart, so I became a monk."

source_sentence: 王言：「卿說是四事徵促，我意不解，願更為我廣說之。」
translation: The king said, "I don't understand your explanation of these four things and their promotion, so please explain them more extensively for me."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「我自問王，王當以誠報我。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "I asked the king myself, and the king will reward me with honesty.

source_sentence: 王年二十三十至四十時，氣力射戲、上象騙馬、行步趍走，當爾時，自視寧有雙無？」
translation: When the king was 20 or 30 to 40 years old, he had the energy to shoot games, mount elephants and horses, and walk around, but at the time, how could he have regarded himself as having neither?"

source_sentence: 王言：「實如賴吒和羅言，我年二十三十至四十時，自視無雙，如我射戲、上象騙馬、行步趍走；今年長老，氣力衰微坐起苦難，意欲有所越蹈，不能越度。」
translation: The king said, "It's true, as Rāṣṭrapāla said, that when I was twenty, thirty, and forty years old, I regarded myself as peerless, like when I shoot games, mount elephants and horses, and walk around. This year, I've grown old, my strength has weakened, I'm having trouble sitting up, and I want to go beyond that, but I can't."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「佛說是一事，我用是故，剃頭鬚作沙門。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "The Buddha said this, and it's for this reason that I shaved my head and became a monk."

source_sentence: 王言：「佛說是事，實奇實善，入我心中。」
translation: The king said, "This is a truly wonderful and good thing that the Buddha teaches, and it's entered my mind."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅問王言：「國中寧有傍臣百官仰王生活者不？」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla asked the king, "Are there any ministers or officials in the king's household who look up to him for a living?"

source_sentence: 王言：「然，有是。」
translation: The king said, "Yes, there is."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「王曾被病困劣著床時不？」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "Has the king ever been sick and confined to his bed?"

source_sentence: 王言：「然，有是。」
translation: The king said, "Yes, there is."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「被病著床時，王呼傍臣百官仰王生活者，教勅言：『今我被病困劇，汝曹共分取我病去。』
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "When he was sick and on his bed, the king summoned a group of ministers who looked up to the king's life and instructed them, 'Now that I'm sick and trapped, will you all share in taking away my illness?'

source_sentence: 王雖有是教，臣下寧能共分王病持去不？」
translation: Despite the king's teaching, how could my ministers share in taking the king's illness away?"

source_sentence: 王言：「不也。
translation: The king said, "No.

source_sentence: 身會當自受之，傍臣不能代。」
translation: The body will accept it for itself, and the ministers won't be able to take it for it."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「佛說是，是為二事，我用是故作沙門。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "The Buddha said this is two things, and I've made myself a monk because of it."

source_sentence: 王言：「實奇實善，入我心中。」
translation: The king said, "It's really wonderful and really good, and it's entered my mind."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅問王言：「若人壽終欲盡且死時，人之意所不喜也，雖不喜亦不能得離於死。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla asked the king, "When a person's life is about to end and he dies, that's something he doesn't like, but even though he doesn't like it, he can't escape death."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「人自知當死，何以故不豫持珍寶著當所生處？」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "A person knows they're going to die, so why wouldn't they hold onto their treasures and attach them to the place where they'll be born?"

source_sentence: 王言：「不能持珍寶豫著當所生處也，皆當棄，空去耳。」
translation: The king said, "You can't hold onto your treasures and hold onto the places where they'll be born; they'll all be discarded and left empty."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「佛說是，是為三事，我用是故作沙門。」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "The Buddha said these are the three things by which I would become a monk."

source_sentence: 王言：「佛說是事，實奇實善，入我心中。」
translation: The king said, "These things, which the Buddha teaches are really wonderful and good, have entered my mind."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅問王言：「王寧有國中安寧、人民熾盛、五穀豐熟？」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla asked the king, "How would the king like to have his country in peace, his people in exuberance, and his grains abundant?"

source_sentence: 王言：「有是。」
translation: The king said, "Yes, it is."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「若有人從東方來，至誠語王，王亦當信其所言：『我從東方來，見有大國，國中豐熟、人民熾盛。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "If someone comes from the east and speaks sincerely to the king, the king will also believe what they say, 'I've come from the east and seen a great country that's rich and its people are flourishing.

source_sentence: 我識道徑，能持王兵往攻取其國。』
translation: I know the way and path, and I can take the king's army and attack that country.'

source_sentence: 王聞是語，寧欲使人往取其國不？」
translation: When the king hears this, would he rather have someone go and take his country?"

source_sentence: 王言：「然，貪其利入，猶欲取之。」
translation: The king said, "Yes, I'd still like to take it because I'm interested in its benefits."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「若復有人從南方來、西方來、北方來者，道說有國如東方者，王寧欲取之不？」
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "Suppose someone from the south, west, or north were to say there's a country like the east, would the king want to take it?"

source_sentence: 王言：「然，貪其利入，猶欲取之。」
translation: The king said, "Yes, I'd like to take it because I'm interested in its profits."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「若復有人從海一邊渡來，至誠語王，王亦信其所言：『言海一邊有大國，國中五穀豐熟、人民熾盛。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "Suppose another person comes across from the other side of the ocean and speaks sincerely to the king, and the king believes what they say, 'They say there's a great country on the other side of the ocean where the grain is plentiful and the people are flourishing.

source_sentence: 我識道徑，能持王兵往攻其國。』
translation: I know the way and path, and I can take the king's army and attack that country.'

source_sentence: 王聞是語，寧欲使人取其國不？」
translation: When the king heard this, would he rather have someone take his country?"

source_sentence: 王言：「然，貪其利入，猶欲取之。」
translation: The king said, "Still, I'd like to get it because I'm greedy for its benefits."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「佛見是事，知人苦貪無厭足也，是為四事，我用是故作沙門。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "When the Buddha sees these things, he knows that people's desire for suffering has no limit.

source_sentence: 佛見是四事，用教誡人。」
translation: The Buddha sees these four things and uses them to teach and admonish people."

source_sentence: 王言：「佛說是事，實奇實善，入我心中。」
translation: The king said, "These things, which the Buddha teaches, are really wonderful and good, and they enter my mind."

source_sentence: 王言：「佛豫知去來現在之事，善乃如是耶？」
translation: The king said, "Does the Buddha know in advance what's past, future, and present, and is it good like this?"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「王自有國及四方國，常不厭足，復悕望海外國。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "The king has his own country and four countries, but he's never tired of them, and he also hopes for a country overseas.

source_sentence: 佛見世間人有財寶者，皆堅藏守之，不肯布施與人，慳貪藏之，更復求索。
translation: When the Buddha saw that people in the world had wealth and treasure, he kept it close to his chest and wouldn't give it to others, storing it in his stash of greed and seeking for more.

source_sentence: 帝王及人民，皆不知厭足，至於死不棄愛欲，會當捨其死，所有財寶皆置空去，當趣所作善惡道。
translation: Emperors and people who don't know satisfaction and don't abandon their desires until death will abandon their deaths, leaving all their possessions and treasures in vain and heading for the paths of good and evil that they will follow.

source_sentence: 善惡隨人，如影隨人。
translation: Good and evil follow people, like shadows following people.

source_sentence: 人死後，家室宗親啼哭悲哀，棺斂葬埋，人生獨生、死亦獨死，身作善惡身獨當之，無有人代者。
translation: When a person dies, their family and clan lament and mourn, and their coffin is reclaimed and buried.

source_sentence: 飲食金銀珍寶，不能令人得道，財富不能救護人命，令不老死。
translation: Food and drink, gold and silver, and treasure can't make someone attain the Way, and wealth can't save a person's life and keep them from growing old and dying.

source_sentence: 人之所思念多端，人之所愛樂也，人志意數轉，不能專一。
translation: A person's thoughts are many and varied, and what a person loves and enjoys, and a person's thoughts change repeatedly, so they can't focus on one thing.

source_sentence: 佛言：『人坐恣意故，以致凶變怨偶恐懼，譬如穿盜者之所念也。
translation: The Buddha says, 'As a result of sitting in wantonness, a person becomes fierce, resentful, and fearful, like the thoughts of a man who wears robes.'

source_sentence: 人從後得之，身所作惡，自陷其死，如世間人作惡，死後當入泥犁、畜生、薜荔中。
translation: When a person attains it later, the evil they do will bring about their own death, just like ordinary people who do evil will be sent to the mire, the animals, or the lily pads after death.

source_sentence: 譬如樹木生華葉成實者，中有花時墮者，中有成果時墮者，中有大時墮者，中有熟時墮者。
translation: It's like a tree that produces flowers and leaves that become real, but there are those who fall when they flower, those who fall when they bear fruit, those who fall when they're large, and those who fall when they're ripe.

source_sentence: 人亦如是，中有從腹中墮者，中有墮地死者，中有半年死者，中有老時死者，人命不可知。』」
translation: So it is with humans; some fall from the womb, some fall to the ground, some die in half a year, some die of old age, and human life can't be known.'"

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅言：「我用是故作沙門，凡人謂我不能治家故作沙門。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla said, "I've become a monk because of this, and ordinary people say I've become a monk because I can't govern my family.

source_sentence: 雖有諸論議，要不如學道。」
translation: Even though there's all this talk, it's not as good as training in the path."

source_sentence: 賴吒和羅說經竟，王便得第一須陀洹道，便受五戒：一者不殺，二者不盜，三者不犯他人婦女，四者不妄語兩舌，五者不飲酒。
translation: After Rāṣṭrapāla finished speaking the sūtra, the king then attained the first stream entry and received the five precepts: 1) don't kill, 2) don't steal, 3) don't violate another person's wife, 4) don't lie and double-talk, and 5) don't drink alcohol.

source_sentence: 王受戒已，即作禮而去。
translation: After he received the precepts, the king made obeisance and departed.

source_sentence: 佛說賴吒和羅經
translation: Foshuo laizha wuluo jing
